blocks.text: You reach for Voss's mind and hit a wall of absolute nothing. A null-ward — embedded somewhere beneath his collar, perhaps in the cybernetic implant at his temple. Your psychic probe bounces back like a fist striking iron, and pain explodes behind your eyes. You flinch. You can't help it.

Voss doesn't move. But his eyes — those spent-ammunition eyes — lock onto you with a new intensity. 'I felt that,' he says, voice flat as a blade. 'Let me be clear, psyker. My mind is my own. Attempt that again and I will have Astropath Seren perform a selective memory-scrub. You will forget this conversation. You will forget your own name. Do we understand each other?' The servo-skull Macharius buzzes, recording every word.

choices.text: You nod, chastened. The Inquisitor's trust will be hard to earn now.
